proxy anonymeter.description: tell you how anonymous your proxy is (transparent, anonymous or elite)

request headers.description: tell you how the server see your request headers

my machine analyzer.description: tell you how the server see your machine throw your useragent

user-agent analyzer.description: get all possible data about the machine using its user-agent

POST.name: user-agent
POST.default: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/74.0.3729.169 Safari/537.36
POST.description: The user-agent you want to analyze

image placeholder.description: get a placeholder image with your wanted dimensions and color to set it in your page faster

endpoints.description: return a square image with a specific size and a random color

URL.name: size
URL.description: the size of the image's dimensions in px

endpoints.description: return a square image with a specific width and color

URL.name: size
URL.description: the size of the image's dimensions in px

URL.name: color
URL.description: the color of the image -- can be rgb, hex (without hashtag #) or known html colors

endpoints.description: return an image with specific width and height and random color

URL.name: width
URL.description: the width of the image in px

URL.name: height
URL.description: the height of the image in px

endpoints.description: return an image with specific width, height and color

URL.name: width
URL.description: the width of the image in px

URL.name: height
URL.description: the height of the image in px

URL.name: color
URL.description: the color of the image -- can be rgb, hex (without hashtag #) or known html colors

dynamic user avatar.description: generate specific profile picture for every user using first letters of its name

endpoints.description: generate profile picture with specific size and random color using user's first letters

URL.name: size
URL.description: the size of the image's dimensions in px

URL.name: username
URL.description: The name of the user -- just 2 names

endpoints.description: generate profile picture with specific size and color using user's first letters

URL.name: size

URL.name: username
URL.description: The name of the user -- just 2 names

URL.name: color
URL.description: the color of the image -- can be rgb, hex (without hashtag #) or known html colors

thumbnail generator.description: convert image to thumbnail with custom width

POST.name: image
POST.description: The image you want to convert to thumbnail

POST.name: width
POST.description: The width needed for the image -- (height is computed dynamically to maintain the scale)

image meta cleaner.description: clean image from meta data to reduce its size and make it untraceable

POST.name: image
POST.description: The image you want to convert to clean from meta data

image base64.description: encode image to base64 string or decode

endpoints.description: Convert any image to base64 encode

POST.name: image
POST.description: The image you want to convert to encode to base64

endpoints.description: Decode any base64 image to the jpg version of it

qr-code generator.description: convert any text into a qrcode

POST.name: text
POST.description: The text you want to encode into qr-code

facebook user-id.description: get the id of any facebook user

cors proxy.description:
simple proxy give your js in the browser the ability to navigate the web, and avoid cors policy

Url Example: /cors-proxy/?url=https://google.com/?q=coffee

endpoints.description: like a proxy it will simulate the request you sent (header/body) on the url you set, then simulate the response back to you

unshorten url.description: convert shorten url to the original one

endpoints.description: unpack the url and return the last destination

POST.name: url
POST.description: shorten url you wanna to unshorten it

endpoints.description: unpack the url and return the all redirects till the destination

POST.name: url
POST.description: shorten url you wanna to unshorten it

text saver -- simple db.description: work as a semi db, that save any text you post to the api. you can read it anytime. it can be used as a cdn also. (token is required) to map saved content to your account

endpoints.description:
save any text post to this endpoint in your request body.
it creates file with random name, and return the full path to that file
